ygData.subject: Re: Smithing Prices
ygData.msgSnippet: If you even bother selling for these prices you are part of the problem. I am not meaning this as an attack at you, but rather as an observation. As I stated I
ygData.messageBody:
If you even bother selling for these prices you are part of the problem. I
am not meaning this as an attack at you, but rather as an observation. As I
stated I don't care that much as I simply won't sell at these prices I would
rather hunt somwhere and get exp and loot than waste my time making banded
armor.

The way I see it is if most smiths stick to a reasonable price the populace
will have to pay for it. Sure there will always be someone who will sell
stupidly cheap but if that is an exception rather than a rule they can't
possibly keep up with demand. I still sell a little at the prices I
mentioned earlier I may not sell as much as others but I make just as much
money in less time. Seems to make sense to me.

Thump Ghoulsbane
Cleric Karana
-----Original Message-----
From: Libertn2@... <Libertn2@...>
To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, July 09, 1999 10:25 AM
Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Smithing Prices


>From: Libertn2@...
>
>On the Karana Server, prices have hit the floor. The following is what I
>sell at (and I have stock in my bank that has been there for weeks):
>
>bracers, gorgets, helms, boots, arms, masks, belts - 5p
>mantles and cloaks 10p
>tunic and legs - 13p
>
>Now this is rediculous but I have masks, arms and mantles in the bank that
I
>cant get rid of at these prices. Go figure. (smithing skill 135).
>
>Hawkwin of Hawkwin's Roaming Emporium
